intro: Lycianthes villosula, commonly known as the hairy physalis, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated calyx that encloses the fruit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into orange-red, lantern-like fruits. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a somewhat heart-shaped appearance. Lycianthes villosula is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
